title: Union Savings & Loans Wins CIMG Award
text:
2 October 2015 15:12 CET Union Savings & Loans Wins CIMG Award By Daily Guide 
Union Savings & Loans has been adjudged the Best Emerging Brand of the Year 2014 by the Charted Institute of Marketing (CIMG). 
The award was given to the company at the recent 26 th CIMG performance awards ceremony held at the Banquet Hall of the State House. 
A citation presented to the company read: 'Through transactions and provision of services to individuals and businesses, your high quality services have ensured customer satisfaction to the SMEs. With a technology-driven system, you have become the company of choice in the savings and loans segment of the market. 
'With a blend of excellent market knowledge, teamwork, well mapped-out distribution networks and robust market insights, you have taken the savings and loans business to another level, which is evident in the high-end low-end market that you currently serve,' the citation said. 
Union Savings and Loans, one of the oldest in the country, in 2013 embarked on a robust rebranding and restructuring process to become a leader in the savings and loans sector. 
The company is hoping to receive a banking licence by 2017 to render quality services to its clients. 
Philip Oti-Mensah, Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the company, expressed excitement for winning the award, stating 'we are delighted to have won this award because we planned for this and after two years of restructuring here we are. 
'This means it pays to be consistent because we decided that we want to be the number one SME Bank and we positioned ourselves to be just that and that is what has brought us this award.' 
He dedicated the award to the hardworking staff of the company and its cherished customers, promising better products and services in the years ahead.
